Class TimerDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • TimerDisplay

  • public class TimerDisplay
extends java.lang.Object
    This class displays the timer graphics and updates accordingly when notified by the Timer thread to repaint.
    Author:
    JillianJiggs

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int CLOCK
      Maximum time the player has to complete the round.
      private java.awt.Frame gameFrame
      refresh the timer graphics
      private int height
      Location & dimensions of time display
      protected boolean running
      refresh the timer
      private int timeElapsed
      pointer to timer decrementer
      private TimerThread timer
      count down timer till the player is out of time
      private int width
      Location & dimensions of time display
      private int x
      Location & dimensions of time display
      private int y
      Location & dimensions of time display

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TimerDisplay()
      Default constructor - does nothing important.
      TimerDisplay(java.awt.Frame mainGame, int clockTime)
      Constructor to initialize the timer thread and the display to paint on the window.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics pane)
      Paints & refreshes the timer display in the game window.
      protected void startTimer()
      Starts running the timer thread
      protected void takeNotice()
      While the timer thread is running, the timer graphics need to be refreshed to display the amount of time left in the round.
      protected void updateTimer(java.awt.Graphics pane)
      Updates timer displayed in the window

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics pane)
        Paints & refreshes the timer display in the game window.

      • startTimer

        protected void startTimer()
        Starts running the timer thread

      • takeNotice

        protected void takeNotice()
        While the timer thread is running, the timer graphics need to be refreshed to display the amount of time left in the round.

        protected void updateTimer(java.awt.Graphics pane)
        Updates timer displayed in the window
        Parameters:
